text:
As Dean, I think about
the kinds of differences
we want to make in the world.

But what kinds of differences
does the world want us to make?

I would like to officially
welcome the Class of 2024.

You're anxious about making
friends and this case method
thing.
And you're also excited.

There's a lot to
look forward to.

But I guess what
I want to say is
it is a marathon, not a sprint.

The talent in this world
is much more evenly
distributed than opportunity.

Business has always been,
for decades, a force
for good in the world.

The challenges
that we face today

all are crying out for
business solutions.

What can we do to address
persistent inequality,

reverse climate
change, advance equity?

If you're actually going
to become the people who

grab these incredibly
complicated problems,

understand them in
all their richness,

marshal the financial,
human, other resources,

take them to those problems
and efficiently solve them,
that's a big job.

The responsibility that
comes with this opportunity
is enormous.

And we are going to
ask a lot of you.

Hard work, humility, the
third piece is humanity.

We all do better when
all of us do better.
And we sincerely--

I can speak to this
from experience--

want every single person
in this room to thrive.

So commit to being
your best self.
Welcome to this community.
The world needs your leadership.
